sure
does rt2500 hardware support WAP?
or it's for the old WEP...
it supposedly does.
I'm not sure if it does. I can enter the information into /etc/network/interfaces and it shows it in iwconfig. But when I ifup eth1 it falls can't ping anything bar itself
maybe it just doesn't do WAP well...
How do you distinguish if it doesn't do WPA well
all I know is that it can't ping outside of itself. IT doesn't show any other errors.
and it works fine on a windows installation. Just can't get it to function on linux
can you connect to AP without WAP?
considering I'm currently connected among other workstations to it. No I wouldn't be able to do it without WPA.
btw, I don't have rt2500 hardware... just a good infor before actually buying any wifi hardware
I knew it worked with WEP out of the box. But read it was easy to configure WPAPSK on it too. But did the configuration and it just doesn't work.
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=78250
which wifi hardware is most likely easy to setup in ubuntu, any experience, Aklys ?
